direction.raw_text: You threw it at me!!       Alright. (to Jack) Did you see that? She belts him again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop hitting me!           Ma'am!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't throw heads at me, (to Jack) and stop calling me "Ma'am"! ANGLE THE HEAD RESUME A beat.  This head looks ripped off the body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is going on here? EXT. BEACHSIDE CAMPSITE - AN HOUR LATER A small tent camp is being set up.  People unpacking.  Two Deputies, BURKE and STEPHENS, present.  Kelly is with Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How big do the bears get?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big but... a bear couldn't do that to a moose or man in water.  On land maybe.  But...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And they're sure he didn't get tangled under the outboard somehow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hank says he's sure. Kelly takes in the scenic surroundings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It really is beautiful, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never been to Maine before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was told they discriminate against people with hygiene. (off Jack) I never believed it. He measure her.  Then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?  Really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Museum of Natural History doesn't send out investigators to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you know, what--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And even if they did, I doubt he or she would have problems with tents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I don't like tents, why--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like tents, mosquitos, look at your fingernails, you have about as much business being in the woods--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with my       --as Emily Post, it doesn't fingernails these are      make sense-- perfectly good--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They sent you out to examine a tooth, why are you out here on the on the lake? A beat.  Might as well tell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am a paleontologist. (throwing it out) I also was dating my boss he turned out to be involved with a co-worker who was also my friend and for the sake of comfort, theirs, I was shipped off to Maine. (then) I don't feel like going back yet. There.  She said it.  He stares back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not making it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.  You don't have to stay out here, why don't--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come, I'm here, I'm staying. Unless there are ticks. We then HEAR the SOUND OF A DESCENDING HELICOPTER.  She looks up.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If this is who I think it is. (as it gets closer) It is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector Cyr.  He's a rich kook mythology professor.  He's done some work with our museum.  He also treks the world to swim with crocodiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crocodiles.  He's an expert on them.  And if he's here... then he must think that's what's in this lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Maine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There have been Northern sightings. But not this North. As HECTOR CYR, this giant ball of life, deboards his chopper--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You beat me.  Balls. (then) I need some of you to help me unpack. (to Burke and Stevens) You and you. (to Keough) Not you. (to Kelly) Who do we have from Fish And Game?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Kelly)                 Me. Who is this man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could see the algae blooms just coming in, how long has this lake been stagnant? (extending his hand to Keough) Hi, Hector Cyr.  The Earth is round and so should you be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Who is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll need any and all topographic studies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait just a second.  You don't just fly in here and start barking orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I apologize, I just don't want to lose the light, we've got time for a quick scout, (to Kelly) you've had work done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flaring)             (frustrated) I have not.           Who is this man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector Cyr, I said it once, let me know when it sinks in, (to Kelly) have you seen it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.                        Mister...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It couldn't be a crocodile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've been migrating north, Kelly, this lake connects to the ocean,--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Cyr!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, we're losing light, (to Kelly) why does the big one heckle me? Kelly yanks him aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector.  The big one has no sense of humor.  And since he's the one who decides whether you get to play, try not to be your obnoxious self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That hurt my feelings. And it did a little.  Hector is a big Teddy Bear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we're gonna go we better go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's here, I'll find him. (to Jack, re Kelly) Did she tell you we had sex together?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never had sex with you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even so, you're allowed to boast. You look thin by the way, I've mentally undressed you, I can see your ribcage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I really don't mean to be discourteous. (patronizing) But how is it a person could come to believe that a crocodile is in New England?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have saltwater glands, they can swim across oceans, it's only a matter of time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what would he do come winter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They can survive winter.  As long as their nostrils don't freeze, they survive, (to Kelly) am I foolish to explain things, he had such trouble with my name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (scolding)          Hey. Hector.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this where it happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Around here.  Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's eaten in the area, he shouldn't be far away.  Crocs hang around the food source.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they're nighttime hunters, Hector, he'd probably be on land now anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cept he wasn't before, was he? (then to Keough) You know, when friends or family members say things, they tend not to register so sometimes it helps to hear it from a total stranger. You're fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector. Suddenly there are ripples, fish breaking surface about thirty feet away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: White perch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are they feeding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't look like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look like they're jumping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look scared. Upon which something grabs the front of Kelly's canoe and with one crisp yank, flips it over like a spoon on a dinner table, sending them all flying. In an instant, Keough and Kelly are swimming for their lives. Screaming/yelling, they scramble for the canoe, climb onto it's flipped-over back.  Breathless, they all exchange confused looks.  "What the hell happened"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: None of us actually saw anything. (then) I realize this Sir, but something flipped us over, I doubt very much it was a mink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't believe her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, it's so rewarding to imagine my tax dollar finding its way to you, you Fucker. (she clicks off)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such the flirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. Wildlife won't send anybody without a confirmation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Same thing from Fish And Game.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something's in that water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well until we see it, we're not gonna be convincing too many people. As DEPUTY SHARON GARE approaches--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sheriff. Keough looks over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might want to see this. They all walk over. ANGLE THE GROUND There's hundreds, maybe a thousand worms squirming, surrounding... a human toe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, worms.  I got a thing about worms. RESUME GARE It's a human toe. Hector studies it, picks it up.  Then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some decomposition, little acidic, it has been swallowed. (to Keough; holding the toe) Is this the man who was killed? Keough deadpans back.  Then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd only just met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you've got a croc alright, they're keystone species.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keystone what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Species, keystones affect the entire ecosystem, that could explain all these worms, the water. You've got a crocodile. (proffering the toe) Bury your friend. Hector gives the toe to Keough, then heads off.  Keough stands there, holding the tow, as we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby crocs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adult males will charge hatchlings. If there's one out there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If one could be out there... why does Fish And Game tell me it's impossible?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they just consult their little indigenous charts. A beat, as she tends to her work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen... if you really do know crocs, you should know how stealth like they are.  I wouldn't be standing a foot from the water. She looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He could be right there and you wouldn't see him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be able to see something. Upon which, Jack tosses a rock over her shoulder.  As it makes a splash, she screams and practically jumps into his arms. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh that's funny.  That was real funny. And she heads off.  OFF Jack, we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He paid us.  Five hundred. Keough continues on toward the tent. INT. HECTOR'S TENT - CONTINUOUS His tent is on the palatial side.  Stereo, generator, he's got a margarita bar going.  There's a party.  Hector's dancing with Deputy Gare, others are enjoying the drinks and MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a beautiful woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And law enforcement, such dangerous work.  The idea that you could die suddenly with no offspring, disconcerting, let's mate, commit your genes to perpetuity. Upon which, Keough enters, doesn't like what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. He goes, turns OFF the MUSIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are here on official business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cocktail?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!! (then) What's with digging the holes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come on land and they're brazen.  They're also attracted to noise, you can see I make a lot of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody out, back to your tents, now! They start to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could she stay, we've tentatively scheduled intercourse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!!  Out! And they all go, including Gare, who shrugs to Keough "he's kind of funny".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You listen to me.  The only reason I'm letting you be part of this is 'cause you got the helicopter and the radar--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deep down, gut check.  I'm growing fond of you and it's liberating to say so. Keough stares back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a whacko. And Keough leaves, to: EXT. CAMPSIGHT - CONTINUOUS As Keough heads off--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That hurt my feelings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skipping stones.  Look how flat that water is, you can get ten skips on a good one. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, uh... Hank and I think it best if you stay on shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever's out there did flip over a canoe--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not staying on shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's too dangerous for--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't fly up here to roast marshmallows--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You flew up here because your boss--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am going out on that boat and why are you picking on me, is this some kind of--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAKE - SUNSET Keough and Kelly are in one canoe, Hector and Jack are alongside in another.  Hector is operating one of his sophisticated sonar devices.  The calm.  The still.  The beauty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CAMPSITE - SUNDOWN Kelly, still in wet clothes, is talking on her portable phone. Keough is there as Hector approaches.  Jack is approaching as well.  Activity bustles in the b.g.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BEACH - NIGHT Kelly is testing a MACHINE that sends out little SQUEAKY SOUNDS, as Jack approaches.  He stops.  Takes a second to... well, admire her.  She's an attractive woman.  He then approaches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. HECTOR'S TENT - NIGHT Two deputies are digging deep pits about thirty feet in front of his tent.  From within we HEAR MUSIC, the SOUNDS of a PARTY. Keough approaches... looks at Deputy Burke, who's digging.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : A CAMPFIRE REVEAL-- EXT. BEACH CAMPSITE - NIGHT Kelly stands, alone, skipping stones.  After a beat, Jack approaches.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: JACK hazing, new fingernails    I'm not picking-- in the woods?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm beginning to see why you were shipped off. And her face falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was an awful thing to say to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry but you're... A beat. He doesn't finish the sentence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do know crocodiles and I won't get in your way. (then) I really do want to be a part of this. Jack reads her, he can see that she does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. (then) We're up at six.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Night. There's a little chemistry here, though both would probably deny it.  He heads off toward his tent, she sits with her book.  She gives one last look, watches him go.  Then she goes back to her book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell are you doing?!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crawling around like a--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm laying a spring trap!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A spring trap!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I keep telling you, they can come on land, I don't wanna wake up in the middle of the night--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I coulda shot you, you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This could end up saving your life,--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAKE - MUCH LATER The lake is still, the campfire is out, the tents are quiet. The quiet SOUNDS of NIGHT.  CRICKETS.  A LOON.  An OWL.  A courageous raccoon looks about, seeing what he can rummage.  By the water... a black bear takes a drink. ANGLE KEOUGH'S TENT He emerges, compelled by a full bladder, wearing only his trousers, carrying a revolver.  He walks into the nearby woods. He removes from his shorts his bladder's connection to the outside world.  Proceeds to URINATE.  Then... he hears something.  The SOUND of RUSTLING LEAVES.  He STOPS URINATING, we HEAR a HALF SECOND of MOVEMENT.  Then quiet.  Must be his imagination.  He RESUMES his business. More RUSTLING, it's not just the sound of dense urine against leaves, he stops... something's out there in the darkness. Quiet.  He starts up for a second, STOPS QUICKLY, and we HEAR it for sure.  Something's RUSTLING TOWARDS him.  With his free hand, Keough pulls out his revolver.  More RUSTLING... Keough points the gun.  Something on the ground is coming toward him. He moves slowly, gun drawn, into the darkness.  The RUSTLING is getting LOUDER.  It's almost upon him.  A beat.  CLOSER. CLOSER.  Then Keough peels away a bush revealing: HECTOR Looking into a gun barrel.  He screams.  Keough screams.  Then--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: KEOUGH You'll be glad you didn't    Hey look, I'm sure you shoot me then, you'll be     finished first in your tongue massaging my          class but I think you need hemorrhoids, just before     to be retired to the big rubber running off to get your      room, where you can play with sister pregnant, who you     soft stuffed reptiles. probably already call mom. And now all the others, awakened, are charging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  What is going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This man takes a pistol     He's crawling around-- to pee!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is an official investigation, and this cuckoo bird is a civilian. I don't care how much money he's got, he's a total mental. And Hector storms off.  A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hurt his feelings.  I think you should go apologize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apologize?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're a team here.  It     He's a fruitcake! won't kill you to get along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look.  The thing about Hector... he takes this crocodile business very... (how to say it) he thinks they're Godly. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He thinks they're what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In his defense, every primitive culture known to man deified them. He's a mythology professor, he thinks crocs are divine conduits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this 'spose to make me take him more serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's to make you understand him, with understanding comes tolerance. Too bad they don't put proverbs in Twinkies, my load would be lighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why does everybody insult my intelligence, I have intelligence, intelligent people eat Twinkies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Keough shoots a look to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's just all get some sleep. And Keough heads off, under--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm an intelligent person. Upon which, he disappears from Earth.  He's stepped into one of Hector's pit traps.  A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shall kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, I don't mean to be annoying with my questions.  But if it is a crocodile which I don't think it is.  And if they do charge these baby hatchling sounds... (to Jack) why exactly would you want to be underwater at the time? (to Hector) With you it makes sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They don't really attack underwater and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That "Walt" guy got hit underwater--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No crocodile has ever--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should take a flax pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if I tranq him Kelly?  He drowns.  You think about that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just saying last resort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again.  Not to be disruptive.  Do we have a problem with it dying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crocodiles don't sever with their teeth, their molars are blunt. As if that's suppose to clear it up.  Keough stares back blankly.  Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this a trick?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'm saying is if it's a crocodile that cut a man in half he would have to be over twenty feet which would make him well over a hundred years old, it would be unthinkable to destroy him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, let's just drop here. Burke lowers the anchor, as Keough just continues to stare at Hector.  Kelly readies the hatchling recorder.  She lowers it into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They respond pretty quick.  I'll wait till you get down before I turn it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. (climbing over) See ya soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck. There was a twinge of real concern in her voice.  He makes eye contact with her.  Then drops over.  Goes under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two years married, divorced, used to be a lawyer, quit, I'm still waiting on his sperm count.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (off Hector's look) Oh as if I'm interested.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As if. (as he's about to go overboard; to Keough) Will you miss me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought a pork chop, maybe we could hang it around your neck for luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thank you, but maybe later you can chew the bark off my big fat log. And Hector drops overboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was that like a homo-sexual remark?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked you to be nice to him. Keough rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He may be a kook but he's also been all over the world with them.  He even swam in the Grimetti with killer Niles all around him, he never got nipped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's why he thinks they're Godly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said he knew it when he looked into their eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You like Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  I don't even know the guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector thinks you like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well Hector's a giant cracker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think Jack's handsome?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just curious.  I can never tell what women think is handsome.  Is he handsome?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well.  He's probably rugged handsome I guess.  Yeah. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I? EXT. UNDERWATER - DAY Jack and Hector, diving together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It shouldn't be taking so long. They both scan the surface.  Dead calm. EXT. UNDERWATER - CONTINUOUS Hector moves about.  We can hear the HATCHLING RECORDER, but he's not seeing anything. EXT. UNDERWATER - (ANOTHER AREA) - CONTINUOUS Jack looks about.  He looks up.  Doesn't see much but he gets an eerie feeling.  Something's out there. EXT. LAKE - CONTINUOUS Keough, Kelly, and Burke, standing idly, scanning the calm surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector, Jack, we show you with about twelve minutes of oxygen left, and you're on the last tank. Time to go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a bust. A beat.  Another beat.  Then... something jerks the boat a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  It was like a tug. Something tugged us. Upon which something really yanks the boat.  So hard... Kelly flips over the back, into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! The boat is moving, being dragged quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something's got the anchor line!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kelly!! But Kelly's alone in the water, the boat being pulled away. RESUME KEOUGH (into headset) Jack!!  Hector!  We're being dragged!! (as he starts the motor; to Burke) Cut the line!  Cut the fucking line! Burke goes to work on the anchor line as we ANGLE Kelly, treading water, in the middle of nowhere.  She's completely vulnerable. EXT. UNDERWATER - CONTINUOUS Hector, swimming for the surface. EXT. LAKE - CONTINUOUS Kelly, treading water.  FIND Keough on the boat, he now has the engine running, fighting against the drag but whatever has that boat has a fucking strong hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut the Goddamn rope!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm trying! And finally, as he severs the rope the boat almost goes airborne with a jump, Burke nearly sails out.  Keough's boat then races to Kelly. ANGLE KELLY
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry up!! Suddenly about thirty feet away... we SEE fish breaking water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!!  Hank!! The boat is zooming toward her.  It arrives.  As Keough and Burke go to pull her aboard, we see a dark shadow rising.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look out!! And Jack explodes out of the water, it was his shadow.  Keough and Burke pull them both aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think.  My hair. (then) Where's Hector?! (to Jack) Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We went in different directions. That water is thick, you can't see through it! EXT. UNDERWATER - CONTINUOUS Hector is swimming toward the surface.  Suddenly... a shadow looms over him.  He looks up. HIS P.O.V. There is no boat.  We can't see it, just a big shadowy mass. RESUME HECTOR He's scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hector!  Hector, we got dragged off position, when you surface, you gotta yell. EXT. UNDERWATER - CONTINUOUS Hector is still charging toward the surface.  The lack of visibility is frightening, something could be six feet away and he wouldn't know it. EXT. LAKE - CONTINUOUS KELLY (pointing) There's bubbles over there!  Look! Keough quickly maneuvers the boat to where Kelly indicated, under--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he is.  Here he comes! And Keough has the boat to him as Hector breaks surface. And they quickly pull Hector on board, all attention is on Hector as they lean over to rescue him.  On the far right... two eyes... moving closer to the oblivious rescuers. Slowly moving in, everybody is so preoccupied with Hector, Deputy Burke, at the end of the boat, is leaning way over to see Hector.  If only he knew what he's not seeing.  The eyes come closer.  They're now in the water right below Burke's head.  How can he not see it?  A beat.  Another beat.  Then... suddenly, a mouth, a dragon, teeth, something, flashes from the water-- snap.  And Deputy Burke's head is simply gone as his limp body hangs over the boat.  Kelly screams in horror. In a microsecond, Burke's head and life are both gone.  OFF their stunned faces, as Kelly continues to scream we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody actually saw it.  It happened sudden. PAN TO FIND Kelly, staring almost blankly, as Jack, finishing a phone call, approaches.  He measures her expression, she's still in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay? (nothing) Kelly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (then) Nobody saw anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (then) U.S. Wildlife is on their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's probably good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Police want to keep it quiet, if the press gets word... lake monster.  They just want us to sit tight. ANGLE KELLY She is visibly undone, she appears almost to be fighting off shock.  Jack puts his hands on her shoulder to steady her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... y'know... (swallows) Yeah. Jack can see she's willing herself to be stoic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man died.  You don't have to be so tough. She nods, appreciatively.  Part of her would love to collapse into him but a bigger part demands that she remain stoic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine.  I uh... I'm fine. PAN TO FIND Keough, walking.  Still visibly shaken.  He unwittingly approaches Hector.  They hold a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he a good man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whenever somebody dies I consider it such a waste that I didn't know him better. A beat.  Then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His head was just... bitten off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to have this recurring nightmare that I was headless. Keough turns to stare at him with incredulity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be on the ground looking up at my body, no head, walking around bumping into everything.  And my parents wouldn't let me in the house 'cause they'd just bought all these new antique lamps and they were afraid I'd knock them over, made sense, and meanwhile, the neighborhood bullies would see my round little head on the ground looking like a ball, and they'd come rushing over to start up a game of soccer.  I'd actually feel grateful just for being allowed into the contest, that's esteem for you, what are your thoughts? Keough has had enough of this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, Hector, I'm sure you're a fine person in your own mental way.  But I think it would be best if you and I didn't speak. And Keough heads off.  He takes about four steps... then SNAP. Up goes his upside-down body like a rocket.  He's stepped in Hector's spring-bow trap.  A beat.  He swings upside-down like a pendulum.  Another beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a setback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to cut me down. 'Cause I'll kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to believe there could be a monster under such peacefulness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I might track the shoreline tomorrow, look for prints. She just stares out as if she didn't hear.  And he fixes his own stare on her.  Feeling it, she turns, catches him looking at her, he diverts the stare.  She feigns a non-reaction.  A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know they say the brain confuses fear for passion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you get scared, the brain releases a chemical, same chemical it releases when somebody's... (a beat) in high school, the thing to do was to take the girl to a scary movie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm saying between the moonlight, a beautiful lake and a monster that bites heads off... you look good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, that was so poetic, Jack.  I'm all moist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me for trying to be nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice?  Nice would be "you look pretty," nice is not some man- eating monster has tricked my brain into making you look good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't say it like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did, you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was trying to pay you a compliment, I was guising it as science 'cause I know you're comfortable in that arena. Science.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man just died, you're hitting on me with science.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beg pardon?  Sorry to intrude but Hank seems to have gotten himself stuck in a tree. EXT. CAMPSITE - SECONDS LATER Hank hangs still, upside down, from the tree, as Hector, Kelly, and Jack approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I probably could've accomplished freeing him myself but he had a look of mayhem on his upside down face. They arrive.  Hank says nothing, he hangs there perfectly still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hank?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. The three exchange looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other than feeling slightly embarrassed, I'm perfectly fine. (then) Could you cut me down?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise you won't kill me, first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have no interest in ever looking at you, Hector. (again) Could you please cut me down? Jack gives Kelly a knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cut, we'll hold him. Hector and Jack grab hold, Kelly cuts, they lower him to the ground.  He rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (then) I lied. And he charges after Hector, who runs toward the beach.  Keough chases, Jack and Kelly pursue, trying to stop him.  And suddenly, exploding out of the woods, a ferocious charging GROWL.  An attack.  Screams all over, a half-second of confusion before we SEE it's a large BLACK BEAR jumping out of the darkness, right at Hector.  Hector dives out of its path. Screams, panic, shouting, as the bear rears up on his hind legs. Seemingly about to lunge when... exploding out of the water the giant jaws of a crocodile. In a flash instant, the beast engulfs the bear, twisting it, slamming it on the ground and then pulling it into the water. The bear fights back ferociously for a second but there can only be one outcome here.  In a matter of seconds, both bear and crocodile have vanished.  And the water is calm again. ANGLE THE FACES Utter catatonia.  Shock.  Whatever they expected to find in this expedition, they weren't remote prepared for that.  There are no words here.  Shock is pre-empting every other human sensory. What they just saw... a crocodile head measuring five feet rise up out of the water and gobbled a fucking bear.  A beat.  Then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.  It's a crocodile.  I'll admit it. A beat as they gulp air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're cut. There is a little blood over Jack's right eye.  He dabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was an Indo-pacific.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scales were oval.  It was an Asian crocodile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Asia?  How... how could he get here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Obviously some asshole in Hong Kong flushed him down a toilet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had to be thirty feet long. Another beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hank.  The little cannon you brought, get it.  Guard the shoreline.  Otherwise, we're done. We made the I.D., our job is finished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, Ms. Paleontologist.  I wanna know why that monster is here.  You got a theory?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why he's that big, I don't know. Why he's here... the wetlands are being developed, crocodiles are moving.  Australia, Fiji, the things have started to cross oceans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But why Maine and why alone?  Crocs are social, why's this guy on the move by himself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he doesn't play well with others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everything a big fucking joke to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bite my bishop. And Keough starts for him, but Jack intercedes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sick of him!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAKE - SUNRISE The steam is lifting off the lake. EXT. LAKE - MORNING Keough, Kelly, Hector, and Deputy Burke are cruising in the whaler.  Hector and Jack are both in full diving gear.  Jack also has a stick gun for protection.  Hector does not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. UNDERWATER - ANGLE ON JACK - DAY Jack, diving.  We HEAR the HIGH PITCH of CROCODILE HATCHLINGS. Visibility is again pretty limited. EXT. LAKE - ANGLE ON HECTOR - UNDERWATER - DAY Hector dives through the dark black water.  Visibility is lousy. EXT. UNDERWATER - THIRTY MINUTES LATER Jack dives, searched.  Looks ahead, sees something... He moves closer... it's the carcass of the moose, no head. EXT. LAKE - AN HOUR LATER Kelly and Keough onboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. LAKE - TWO HOURS LATER The boats sit still on the dead calm water.  Kelly works the RADAR, Keough covertly eats a Twinkie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. CAMPSITE - SUNSET Burke's body is being loaded into an ambulance.  People move in silence, the wake of tragedy.  A few State Troopers are on the scene.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT. BEACH - NIGHT Kelly and Jack.
dialogue.name: dialogue
